Dementia Friendly Business Training

A certification for an organization to become a dementia friendly location, 50% of staff must go through the 90 minute training.

Dementia Friends

  • Dementia Friends is a global movement that started in the United Kingdom. It was brought to Indiana in 2017.

What is a Dementia Friend?

  • A Dementia Friend is someone who wants to make a positive difference in the lives of people living with dementia through increased awareness and support.
  • Even small changes can help support people living with dementia to remain included, accepted and connected with their community.

Our Mission

The Dementia Friends Indiana movement seeks to advance education and awareness of dementia, reduce the stigma associated with the disease, and create community environments that are welcoming and conducive for those living with dementia.

How?

At least 50% of staff must attend the Dementia Friendly Business Training through an in-person session or online at www.alzresourceindiana.org.

Once the staff requirement is met, the Organization will receive a certificate, window decal, and be added to our online list of certified businesses to be recognized by the community as a Dementia Friendly Location.
